skill.name: webapp-testing
skill.description: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright. Supports verifying frontend functionality, debugging UI behavior, capturing browser screenshots, and viewing browser logs.

security_audit.summary: Legitimate web testing toolkit using Playwright. Static findings are false positives: LICENSE.txt cryptographic warnings are standard legal text, subprocess usage is user-controlled for local dev servers, markdown backticks in SKILL.md are documentation formatting. No data exfiltration, credential theft, or persistence mechanisms detected.

medium_findings.title: Shell execution with user-controlled commands
medium_findings.description: with_server.py uses subprocess.Popen with shell=True to execute server commands provided via CLI. This is intentional for supporting compound shell commands. Commands are user-provided for local development.

content.user_title: Test web apps with Playwright automation
content.value_statement: Manual web application testing is slow and error-prone. This toolkit provides Playwright-based automation for testing local web apps, capturing screenshots, and debugging frontend behavior.
actual_capabilities: Launch Chromium browser in headless mode for automated testing
Start and manage local development servers automatically
Capture full-page screenshots of web pages
Discover and interact with buttons, links, and form elements
Capture browser console logs for JavaScript debugging
Wait for network idle state before performing actions
limitations: Designed for local development servers only, not production websites
Requires Playwright and browser binaries to be installed
Scripts must be run directly from the skill directory

use_cases.title: Test React, Vue, Svelte apps
use_cases.description: Automate interaction testing for single-page applications during development.

use_cases.title: Create end-to-end test suites
use_cases.description: Build automated UI tests that verify form submissions and user flows.

use_cases.title: Debug frontend issues remotely
use_cases.description: Capture screenshots and console logs to diagnose JavaScript errors.

prompt_templates.title: Start dev server
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the webapp-testing skill to start a development server on port 5173 using npm run dev, then run a Playwright script to verify the homepage loads correctly.

prompt_templates.title: Find UI elements
prompt_templates.scenario: Discovering interactive elements on a page
prompt_templates.prompt: Use webapp-testing to navigate to http://localhost:3000, wait for network idle, then list all buttons, links, and input fields on the page.

prompt_templates.title: Capture bug screenshot
prompt_templates.prompt: Start the dev server on port 5173, navigate to the dashboard, and take a full-page screenshot when the page loads. Save the screenshot to /tmp/dashboard.png.

prompt_templates.title: Debug console errors
prompt_templates.prompt: Use webapp-testing to visit http://localhost:5173, capture all console messages, and save them to /tmp/console.log for debugging.

output_examples.input: Test my React app on port 5173. Find all buttons and take a screenshot.
output: Navigated to http://localhost:5173 and waited for network idle
Found 4 buttons: Submit, Cancel, Save Changes, Delete Account

output_examples.input: Debug the login form on my local app. Capture console errors.
output: Captured 3 console errors: Uncaught ReferenceError, TypeError in auth.js
Screenshot of error state saved to /tmp/login-error.png

best_practices: Always wait for networkidle state before inspecting dynamic web applications
Use the with_server.py helper script to manage server lifecycle automatically
Run scripts with --help flag first to understand available options
anti_patterns: Do not inspect DOM elements before the page finishes loading
Do not forget to close the browser after automation completes
Do not use hardcoded selectors without first discovering them dynamically

faq.question: Which browsers are supported?
faq.answer: This skill uses Chromium in headless mode by default. Playwright supports Firefox and WebKit as well.

faq.question: Can I test production websites?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for local development servers. Testing production sites may violate terms of service.

faq.question: How do I run multiple servers at once?
faq.answer: Use multiple --server and --port flags. Example: --server npm run dev --port 5173 --server python api.py --port 3000.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill runs locally on your machine. It only accesses files and servers you explicitly specify.

faq.question: Why is my screenshot not capturing the full page?
faq.answer: Ensure you use full_page=True in the screenshot call and wait for networkidle before capturing.

faq.question: How is this different from Selenium or Puppeteer?
faq.answer: Playwright offers better reliability, faster execution, and built-in support for modern web features.
